title: Fix H2TopNRecordsQueryDAO#readSampledRecords SQL Exception
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting pull request

- Why submit this pull request?
- [x] Bug fix
- [ ] New feature provided
- [ ] Improve performance

- Related issues

___
### Bug fix
- Bug description.

```
Caused by: org.h2.jdbc.JdbcSQLException: Syntax error in SQL statement "SELECT * FROM TOP_N_DATABASE_STATEMENT WHERE  AND TIME_BUCKET[*] >= ? AND TIME_BUCKET <= ? ORDER BY LATENCY DESC  LIMIT 10 "; SQL statement:
select * from top_n_database_statement where  and time_bucket >= ? and time_bucket <= ? order by latency desc  limit 10 [42000-196]
        at org.h2.message.DbException.getJdbcSQLException(DbException.java:345) ~[h2-1.4.196.jar:1.4.196]
        at org.h2.message.DbException.get(DbException.java:179) ~[h2-1.4.196.jar:1.4.196]
        at org.h2.message.DbException.get(DbException.java:155) ~[h2-1.4.196.jar:1.4.196]
        at org.h2.message.DbException.getSyntaxError(DbException.java:191) ~[h2-1.4.196.jar:1.4.196]
        at org.h2.command.Parser.getSyntaxError(Parser.java:534) ~[h2-1.4.196.jar:1.4.196]
        at org.h2.command.Parser.prepareCommand(Parser.java:261) ~[h2-1.4.196.jar:1.4.196]
        at org.h2.engine.Session.prepareLocal(Session.java:578) ~[h2-1.4.196.jar:1.4.196]
        at org.h2.engine.Session.prepareCommand(Session.java:519) ~[h2-1.4.196.jar:1.4.196]
        at org.h2.jdbc.JdbcConnection.prepareCommand(JdbcConnection.java:1204) ~[h2-1.4.196.jar:1.4.196]
        at org.h2.jdbc.JdbcPreparedStatement.<init>(JdbcPreparedStatement.java:73) ~[h2-1.4.196.jar:1.4.196]
        at org.h2.jdbc.JdbcConnection.prepareStatement(JdbcConnection.java:288) ~[h2-1.4.196.jar:1.4.196]
        at com.zaxxer.hikari.pool.ProxyConnection.prepareStatement(ProxyConnection.java:318) ~[HikariCP-3.1.0.jar:?]
        at com.zaxxer.hikari.pool.HikariProxyConnection.prepareStatement(HikariProxyConnection.java) ~[HikariCP-3.1.0.jar:?]
        at org.apache.skywalking.oap.server.library.client.jdbc.hikaricp.JDBCHikariCPClient.executeQuery(JDBCHikariCPClient.java:113) ~[library-client-8.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar:8.0.0-SNAPSHOT]
```

body:
Please answer these questions before submitting pull request

- Why submit this pull request?
- [x] Improve performance

- Related issues
___
### New feature or improvement
- Describe the details and related test reports.
1. Use FilterContext replace QueryContext.(reduce scoring cost and use filter cache)
2. reduce query index scope
   - range query use `multiple indices` `ignore_unavailable` params ignore missing or closed index
   - traceId query get the trace start time (got in #4353). add one more(next) index to query.

title: support class cache for ByteBuddy
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting pull request

- Why submit this pull request?
- [ ] Bug fix
- [x] New feature provided
- [ ] Improve performance

- Related issues
when use skywalking agent ,arthas is can‘t work well
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/4820
[Question] How to advice a class that have been intercepted by another javaagent but not loaded 
https://github.com/raphw/byte-buddy/issues/829
___
### Bug fix
- Bug description.

- How to fix?

___
### New feature or improvement
- Describe the details and related test reports.
ByteBuddy generates auxiliary classes with different random names every time. When other javaagent executes retransform, it will trigger the SkyWalking agent to enhance the class again. The bytecode regenerated by ByteBuddy is changed, the fields and imports are modified, and the retransform fails.
Support class cache for ByteBuddy, solve the problem of other javaagent retransform classes enhanced by SkyWalking.
https://github.com/hengyunabc/skywalking-error-demo test pass.

title: fix hystrix plugin cause biz error
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting pull request

- Why submit this pull request?
- [x] Bug fix
- [ ] New feature provided
- [ ] Improve performance

- Related issues
https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/4850
___
### Bug fix
- Bug description.
this problem is, origin object HystrixConcurrencyStrategyDefault is wrapped to HystrixConcurrencyStrategy. under hystrix 1.4.3 com.netflix.hystrix.HystrixRequestLog#getCurrentRequest(com.netflix.hystrix.strategy.concurrency.HystrixConcurrencyStrategy) this method doesn't check isCurrentThreadInitialized, but checked in other high version
- How to fix?
like hystrix high version, Return null if the {@link HystrixRequestContext} has not been initialized for the current thread.
___
### New feature or improvement
- Describe the details and related test reports.

title: Increased Vert.x support
body:
- Why submit this pull request?
- [x] Bug fix
- [ ] New feature provided
- [x] Improve performance

- Related issues

___
### Bug fix

Fixes https://github.com/apache/skywalking/issues/3338. @wentjiang had the right idea for the fix but the method chosen to enhance is not present ver. 3.5+. I've chosen another method that also works and is present in all versions. 

___
### New feature or improvement

I added support for ver. 3.9.1 as well for more complex route handling. The tests I've been using were too simple so I made them more realisitic. The tests I'm using now look like:
 - User sends request to `/web-case`
- `/web-case` sends a request to `/healthcheck` (ver. 3.5- = sync / ver. 3.6+ = async)
- Once response is recieved another request is sent to `/withBodyHandler` (ver. 3.5- = sync / ver. 3.6+ = async)
- Before `/withBodyHandler` is called this is processed by Vert.x's internal `BodyHandler`
- `BodyHandler` passes request off to `/withBodyHandler`
- Once the response is received the original request to `/web-case` is responded to

This results in the segment trace stack:
```
ENTER: /case/web-case
     ASYNC SPAN STARTED [1]
     LOCAL: VertxWebController$$Lambda$.handle(RoutingContext)
          EXIT: /case/healthCheck
               ASYNC SPAN STARTED [2]
          CLOSE EXIT
     CLOSE LOCAL
CLOSE ENTER

ENTER: /case/healthCheck
     ASYNC SPAN STARTED [3]
     LOCAL: VertxWebController$$Lambda$.handle(RoutingContext)
           ASYNC SPAN FINISHED [3]
     CLOSE LOCAL
CLOSE ENTER

ASYNC SPAN FINISHED [2]
LOCAL: #/case/healthCheck
     EXIT: /case/web-case/withBodyHandler
          ASYNC SPAN STARTED [4]
     CLOSE EXIT
CLOSE LOCAL

ENTER: /case/web-case/withBodyHandler
     ASYNC SPAN STARTED [5]
     LOCAL: BodyHandlerImpl.handle(RoutingContext)
     EXIT LOCAL
CLOSE ENTER

LOCAL: VertxWebController$$Lambda$.handle(RoutingContext)
     ASYNC SPAN FINISHED [5]
CLOSE LOCAL

ASYNC SPAN FINISHED [4]
LOCAL: #/vertx-web-3_54minus-scenario/case/web-case/withBodyHandler
     ASYNC SPAN FINISHED [1]
CLOSE LOCAL
```

If you look at the above the `ENTER: /case/web-case/withBodyHandler` is called on a separate context than `LOCAL: VertxWebController$$Lambda$.handle(RoutingContext)`. This is because of the added `BodyHandlerImpl.handle(RoutingContext)`. This would occur with any additional handlers before the user-code handler. With the added solution you can add additional handlers (e.g. `CorsHandler`) and it'll still result in the spans being created correctly:
![trace-list](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3278877/83239063-591ef480-a1a8-11ea-9afb-65a37c5d7c0e.png)

Apologies for the constant changes. I believe this PR to offer the most thorough support and I wanted to make sure to get better Vert.x support in SkyWalking 8.0.0. When I saw the previous PR couldn't support 3.9.1, I rushed it through because I saw there were bigger changes that I needed to make and I wasn't sure how quickly I could make them.

labels.name: plugin
labels.description: Plugin for agent or collector. Be used to extend the capabilities of default implementor.

title: Fix ApdexMetrics bug when the number of requests for a service per day is more than 2147483647/10000
body:

- [x] Bug fix
- [ ] New feature provided

___
### Bug fix
- Bug description.
ApdexMetrics calculation method (sNum * 10000 + tNum * 10000 / 2) / totalNum
when sNum more then 214749，sNum * 10000 will exceed the maximum value of int。
- How to fix?
Change type of `sNum`,`tNum`,`totalNum`   form int to long。

title: Increased support for Vertx
body:
- Why submit this pull request?
- [x] Improve performance

___
### New feature or improvement

I've split the Vert.x Web tests into two scenarios (3.54minus & 3.6plus). In Vert.x 3.6 they introduced the ability to pass the Router directly to the server handler (https://github.com/vert-x3/vertx-web/blob/3.6.0/vertx-web/src/main/java/io/vertx/ext/web/Router.java#L64). To handle this I had to create a new scenario which uses the newer way of setting up the Router. I also added better support for their web-client which is just an extension of the already supported http-client.

You can verify things are correct by comparing `test/plugin/scenarios/vertx-web-3.54minus-scenario/config/expectedData.yaml` to `test/plugin/scenarios/vertx-web-3.6plus-scenario/config/expectedData.yaml`. Even though the Router is setup differently and one uses HttpClient and the other uses WebClient, the `expectedData.yml` files are essentially the same.

labels.name: plugin
labels.description: Plugin for agent or collector. Be used to extend the capabilities of default implementor.

title: Keep ID as ref ID in the readSampledRecords

Otherwise, this GraphQL query will cause an error.

title: Group Parameterized Endpoints
body:
# Group Parameterized Endpoints
In most cases, the endpoint should be detected automatically through the language agents, service mesh observability solution, or configuration of the meter system.

There are some special cases, especially when people use REST style URI, the application codes put the parameter in the endpoint name, such as putting order id in the URI, like `/prod/ORDER123` and `/prod/ORDER123`. But logically, people expect they could have an endpoint name like `prod/{order-id}`. This is the feature of parameterized endpoint grouping designed for.

Current, user could set up grouping rules through the static YAML file, named `endpoint_name_grouping.yml`, or use Dynamic Configuration to initial and update the endpoint grouping rule.

## Configuration Format
No matter in static local file or dynamic configuration value, they are sharing the same YAML format.

```yaml
grouping:
  # Endpoint of the service would follow the following rules
  - service-name: serviceA
    rules:
      # Logic name when the regex expression matched.
      - endpoint-name: /prod/{id}
        regex: \/prod\/.+
```

Also, this makes the meter system more flexible, even we could create new metrics on the runtime if we really need to do so.

title: Polish metrics logic, fix service traffic bug
body:
I am reviewing our demo env carefully, fixed the following.
1. Service Traffic should serialize and deserialize the time bucket, otherwise, there is a chance `service_traffic-0` generated.
1. Service Traffic should serialize and deserialize the time bucket, otherwise, there is a chance `service_traffic-0` generated.
1. Make top N results more clear about the owner. Previously, the same endpoint names of different services look the same.
1. Sync UI.
1. Fix service traffic equal and hashcode method. The time bucket is not a part of the entity attribute.

title: Mariadb JDBC plugin
body:
Please answer these questions before submitting pull request

- Why submit this pull request?
- [ ] Bug fix
- [x] New feature provided
- [ ] Improve performance

- Related issues
#3907 

___
### New feature or improvement
- A JDBC driver plugin implemented for Mariadb. As Mariadb is based on the Mysql project, there are similarities between two drivers. 
- Mariadb uses the Mysql url format so I re-used the `MysqlURLParser` with a small modification.
- PreparedStatement parameter string building logic is exactly the same between Mysql, PostgreSql and Mariadb. I created a parameter builder class to re-use between these plugins. That's why I touched a little bit to Postgresql and Mysql plugins and I checked the unit tests and scenarios to be sure to not break anything.
- The latest minor versions of the the driver(2.x) are included in the test scenario.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1737260/80924762-26413680-8d8b-11ea-9589-10ee831d70df.png)

title: Fix the cache unclear bug.
body:
The cache should be read-once. I forgot to support this in the new implementation, the aggregation will be inaccurate and keep growing. This would burn the CPU and storage.

This is a very serious bug.

title: Optimize L1 and L2 aggregation.
body:
- L1 Aggregation. Use **MergableBufferedData** to replace **ReadWriteSafeCache**. This could avoid the lock for every time aggregation of L1.
- L2 Aggregation. Support **batch mode** in the **MergableBufferedData**, also reduce the lock and lock race for the aggregation of L2.
- Remove the ** endOfBatch** from the ** StreamData**. With the batch mode supported in the workers, we don't need that. We take advantage of DataCarrier batch consuming feature.

title: New ReadWriteSafeCache. Rewrite the whole Window and Collection. Simplify codes
body:
The old Window and Collection are very hard to read and understand, so I rewrite them to the new **ReadWriteSafeCache** and **BufferedData**.  

In theory, they are the same in performance and code logic. But the new ReadWriteSafeCache includes more clear lock logic inside, and easier to use.
